text: Labor Senator Jenny McAllister says there should be a focus on why women are traditionally retiring with less money than men, ahead of a retirement income review. The inquiry, announced last year, will determine how people are handling their savings and superannuation in preparation for retirement. Ms McAllister told Sky News “the government has announced a review, but just inexplicably there is no mention of women in the terms of reference.” “Women are retiring with just over half the superannuation balances as men and the consequence of that is we are seeing greater numbers of older women homeless and in poverty". “It’s a structural problem that needs to be fixed.” Image: News Corp Australia
